barbarian: You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 +1 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may move at the end of your turn.
You may move at the end of your turn and/or move another character to the location where you end your turn.
berserker: You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 +1 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 +2 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 +3 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 +4 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand or the top card of your deck to add 1d10 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand or the top card of your deck to add 1d10 +1 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand or the top card of your deck to add 1d10 +2 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand or the top card of your deck to add 1d10 +3 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand or the top card of your deck to add 1d10 +4 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may move at the end of your turn.
You may move at the end of your turn and/or move another character to the location where you end your turn.
Add 2 to your check to acquire a weapon.
Add 4 to your check to acquire a weapon.
When you play Blessing of Gorum, add d12 instead of the normal die.
juggernaut: You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 +1 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 +2 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may bury a card from your hand to add 1d10 +3 to your Strength, Melee, or Constitution check.
You may move at the end of your turn.
You may move at the end of your turn and/or move another character to the location where you end your turn.
When you are dealt Combat damage, reduce that damage by 1.
When you are dealt Combat or any other type of damage, reduce that damage by 1.
Add 2 to your check to acquire a armor.
Add 4 to your check to acquire a armor.
When you play Blessing of Gorum, add d12 instead of the normal die.
